I am a bioinformatics student interested in protein coevolution and interaction. The easiest way to get in touch with me is by email.

I am currently a research student in Bioinformatics at CENTRIA, working under supervision of Prof. Ludwig Krippahl. We are investigating the use of constraint programming (CP) to the refinement of Multiple Sequence Alignments (MSA) in order to identify correlated mutations. The underlying idea is that classic alignment algorithms try to minimize a global (or local) score under the default assumption of independent mutations, hidding the traits of coevolution. CP can help refining the less conserved portions of the MSA in an attempt to unveil significant correlations. Such correlations can give us clues about the way in which these proteins interact.

In the past, I received an eurobachelor's degree in Biochemistry and a master's degree in Molecular Genetics and Biomedicine, from Universidade Nova de Lisboa. Although my background is not in computer science, I have become more and more interested, especially after some coursework in "Programming for Experimental Sciences" and "Statistics", where we used Octave and R as the main tools. For my master thesis, I worked in the lab of Prof. Maria João Romão on a project entitled, "Structural and functional studies on human Phenylalanine Hydroxylase". This project concerned the biochemical characterization of hPAH and several mutants with enhance stability, in an attempt to solve the structure of the full length tetrameric PAH. I worked also on a small term studentship at the Glycobiology lab.

I will move again in September 2012 to start a Wellcome Trust PhD studentship at the College of Life Sciences, University of Dundee. Here I plan to work in the lab of Prof. Geoff Barton. My project is going to focus the computational analysis and prediction of protein interactions within a Bayesian framework.

When I'm not working on these projects, I am probably browsing the web, playing with friends, or just chilling outside. Always interested in collaborations and fun projects, drop me a line if you want to say hi!

You can also find me on Twitter, GitHub and LinkedIn.
